com.datasift.dropwizard.hbase

Class InstrumentedHBaseClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.datasift.dropwizard.hbase.InstrumentedHBaseClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HBaseClient

    public class InstrumentedHBaseClient
extends Object
implements HBaseClient
    An HBaseClient that is instrumented with Metrics.

    For each asynchronous request method, a Timer tracks the time taken for the request.

    This implementation proxies all requests through an underlying HBaseClient, provided to the constructor; it merely layers instrumentation on top of the underlying HBaseClient.

    See Also:
    HBaseInstrumentation

    • Constructor Detail

      • InstrumentedHBaseClient

        public InstrumentedHBaseClient(HBaseClient client,
                       String name)
        Creates a new InstrumentedHBaseClient for the given underlying client.

        The default MetricsRegistry will be used to register the Metrics.

        Parameters:
        client - the underlying HBaseClient implementation to dispatch requests.

      • InstrumentedHBaseClient

        public InstrumentedHBaseClient(HBaseClient client,
                       com.yammer.metrics.core.MetricsRegistry registry,
                       String name)
        Creates a new InstrumentedHBaseClient for the given underlying client.

        Instrumentation will be registered with the given MetricsRegistry.

        A new HBaseInstrumentation container will be created for this HBaseClient with the given MetricsRegistry.

        Parameters:
        client - the underlying HBaseClient implementation to dispatch requests.
        registry - the MetricsRegistry to register Metrics with.
        name - the name of the client to register metrics under.

      • InstrumentedHBaseClient

        public InstrumentedHBaseClient(HBaseClient client,
                       HBaseInstrumentation metrics)
        Creates a new InstrumentedHBaseClient for the given underlying client.

        Instrumentation will be contained by the given HBaseInstrumentation instance.

        Note: this is only really useful for sharing instrumentation between multiple HBaseClient instances, which only really makes sense for instances configured for the same cluster, but with different client-side settings. Use with caution!!

        Parameters:
        client - the underlying HBaseClient implementation to dispatch requests.
        metrics - the HBaseInstrumentation containing the Metrics to use.
